Feature Name: Contact Database can include both member and non-member details
The data that needs to be stored for each contact can be configured
The Contact Database provides multiple levels of hierarchy e.g. Organisation, Division, Contact
The Contact Database can be searched, filtered and segmented in a number of different ways
Via the Contact Database a person\'s complete relationship with the organisation can be viewed e.g. membership(s), event registrations, online store purchases, email communications
Membership pricing can be configured including early bird discounts, joining fee, late fee
Pro-rata membership pricing is available for a number of time periods, e.g. daily, quarterly
Memberships can be administered and reported by subsets (e.g. by division or state)
Memberships can be processed through a number of different statuses reflecting the organisation\'s administration processes
Individuals can apply for membership
Where appropriate fees can be paid via the website
Corporations can apply for membership and nominate employees to receive membership benefits
A range of membership types are supported
Automated communications to member through renewal workflow are supported -e.g. renewal reminder, renewal acknowledgement
Payments for renewals collected online, and invoices generated
Early Bird renewal pricing is available
Members can update there own details at any time
The details that members can update can be configured to be a subset of total contact database information
Different levels of memberships can have access to different information/services
Different subsets of members can be targeted based on membership type
Members receive directory listings as part of their membership benefits
Events can be quicklyand easily published onto the website
The details to be captured for an event can be configured and presented to the end user in a consistent layout
Any number of categories/subcategories of products can be defined
Details presented about each product can be configured
Different groups of users (e.g. members) can receive different store pricing to other groups (e.g.non-members)
